id: Note that the hasTextualName property has an implicit range of rdfs:Literal. This is purposeful, so that users can specify any element that has a name with or without a language tag without concern for conflicting datatypes (i.e., xsd:string vs. rdf:langString, which are logically disjoint).
name: Note that the hasTextualName property has an implicit range of rdfs:Literal. This is purposeful, so that users can specify any element that has a name with or without a language tag without concern for conflicting datatypes (i.e., xsd:string vs. rdf:langString, which are logically disjoint).

id: something that another concept stands for, exemplifies, symbolizes, or otherwise mentions
name: something that another concept stands for, exemplifies, symbolizes, or otherwise mentions

id: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate duplication with concepts in LCC and remove the unused hasDispositionDate property, whose semantics were unclear at best.

name: relates a contract, agreement, jurisdiction, or other legal construct and the regulation, policy, procedure, or legal person that regulates or oversees (governs) it

id: combination of alphanumeric characters corresponding to a label for something
name: combination of alphanumeric characters corresponding to a label for something

id: Text-valued tags may be useful for automated transformation or encoding systems, such as those used to produce IETF compliant language tags in XML. Such tags are required to be string-valued in FIBO, but not language-tagged strings.
name: Text-valued tags may be useful for automated transformation or encoding systems, such as those used to produce IETF compliant language tags in XML. Such tags are required to be string-valued in FIBO, but not language-tagged strings.

id: relationship between an event or set of events or factors (the cause) and a second event, phenomenon, situation, or result (the effect), where the second event or outcome is understood as a consequence of the first
name: relationship between an event or set of events or factors (the cause) and a second event, phenomenon, situation, or result (the effect), where the second event or outcome is understood as a consequence of the first

id: (of a situation or event) includes (something) as a necessary part or result
name: (of a situation or event) includes (something) as a necessary part or result

id: indicates the party that has assigned or appointed someone to an office or position
name: indicates the party that has assigned or appointed someone to an office or position

id: is made concrete or is realized by
name: is made concrete or is realized by

id: specifies the name used to refer to a party in legal communications
name: specifies the name used to refer to a party in legal communications

id: This property is intended to cover assigning a job or role to someone, selecting or designating someone to fill an office or a position, and fixing or setting by authority or by mutual agreement.
name: This property is intended to cover assigning a job or role to someone, selecting or designating someone to fill an office or a position, and fixing or setting by authority or by mutual agreement.

id: 'is signified by' relates a concept to some textual or other symbol which is intended to convey the sense of that concept or to some form of words that sets out the meaning of that concept.
name: 'is signified by' relates a concept to some textual or other symbol which is intended to convey the sense of that concept or to some form of words that sets out the meaning of that concept.

id: is a concrete realization or example of
name: is a concrete realization or example of

id: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified to remove the deprecated hasTag property.
name: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified to remove the deprecated hasTag property.

id: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move the property, 'is conferred on' to the Legal Capacity ontology and to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move the property, 'is conferred on' to the Legal Capacity ontology and to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: identifies some party or something that produces something via some equation, logic, or rules
name: identifies some party or something that produces something via some equation, logic, or rules

id: This property should be read as being the property of some thing and as referring to a logical union of social construct (in the informative abstractions ontology) and legal person.
name: This property should be read as being the property of some thing and as referring to a logical union of social construct (in the informative abstractions ontology) and legal person.

id: creates through a fabrication, manufacturing or production process
name: creates through a fabrication, manufacturing or production process

id: indicates a name by which something is frequently referred, without reference to any formal usage or structure
name: indicates a name by which something is frequently referred, without reference to any formal usage or structure

id: This ontology defines a set of general purpose relations for use in other FIBO ontology elements. These include a number of properties required for reuse across the foundations and business entities models.
name: This ontology defines a set of general purpose relations for use in other FIBO ontology elements. These include a number of properties required for reuse across the foundations and business entities models.

name: has and exercises authority over, regulates

id: This property should be read as describing some legal power or duty, some commitment or some social construct being conferred as a result of some social construct such as an agreement or some legal authority. These concepts, which would describe the kind of thing of which this is a property, and the kinds of thing in terms of which this property is framed, are outside the scope of this model and so are not shown.
name: This property should be read as describing some legal power or duty, some commitment or some social construct being conferred as a result of some social construct such as an agreement or some legal authority. These concepts, which would describe the kind of thing of which this is a property, and the kinds of thing in terms of which this property is framed, are outside the scope of this model and so are not shown.

id: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified to loosen constraints on properties using xsd:dateTime in their range to allow for more flexible representation, and to add properties including produces, isProducedBy.
name: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified to loosen constraints on properties using xsd:dateTime in their range to allow for more flexible representation, and to add properties including produces, isProducedBy.

name: relates an individual or organization to a position, role, or other designation

id: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the issue resolutions identified in the FIBO FND 1.2 RTF report.
name: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the issue resolutions identified in the FIBO FND 1.2 RTF report.

id:
ontology structure
	(5) to incorporate changes to the specification metadata to support documentation at the family, specification, module, and ontology level, similar to the abbreviations
	(6) to move the ontology from the Utilities module to an independent Relations module
	(7) to revise a number of definitions, per discussion with various stakeholders.
	(8) to augment the definitions to include entity names from Business Entities.
name:
ontology structure
	(5) to incorporate changes to the specification metadata to support documentation at the family, specification, module, and ontology level, similar to the abbreviations
	(6) to move the ontology from the Utilities module to an independent Relations module
	(7) to revise a number of definitions, per discussion with various stakeholders.
	(8) to augment the definitions to include entity names from Business Entities.

id: grants or bestows by virtue of some authority
name: grants or bestows by virtue of some authority

id: is the relationship between an event (the effect) and a second event (the cause), where the first event is understood as a consequence of the second; also, the relationship between a set of factors (causes) and a phenomenon (the effect)
name: is the relationship between an event (the effect) and a second event (the cause), where the first event is understood as a consequence of the second; also, the relationship between a set of factors (causes) and a phenomenon (the effect)

id: The target or range of this property should be read as always being some kind of 'relative thing', that is a thing defined in some context. Generally this will be a 'party in role'. This property is not intended to be used to relate a thing to some independent thing which it is provided by, only to something in the role of being that which provides it.
name: The target or range of this property should be read as always being some kind of 'relative thing', that is a thing defined in some context. Generally this will be a 'party in role'. This property is not intended to be used to relate a thing to some independent thing which it is provided by, only to something in the role of being that which provides it.

id: indicates the party that possesses and has at least partial control of something, regardless of ownership
name: indicates the party that possesses and has at least partial control of something, regardless of ownership

id: Relations.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate elements that have been deprecated for several quarters (FND-386).
name: Relations.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate elements that have been deprecated for several quarters (FND-386).

id: Relations.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: Relations.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move hasAcquisitionDate to Financial Dates to improve usability and simplify reasoning, to eliminate circular definitions, to deprecate fibo-fnd-rel-rel;hasTag in favor of the simpler LCC property of the same name, to loosen domain restrictions on some properties which were too narrowly specified, and to add two new properties, describes and isDescribedBy, which are more appropriate for certain cases where we were using characterizes and isCharacterizedBy.
name: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move hasAcquisitionDate to Financial Dates to improve usability and simplify reasoning, to eliminate circular definitions, to deprecate fibo-fnd-rel-rel;hasTag in favor of the simpler LCC property of the same name, to loosen domain restrictions on some properties which were too narrowly specified, and to add two new properties, describes and isDescribedBy, which are more appropriate for certain cases where we were using characterizes and isCharacterizedBy.

id: associates a string-valued name, reference name, or appellation with something
name: associates a string-valued name, reference name, or appellation with something

id: The target or range of this property should be read as always being some kind of 'relative thing', that is a thing defined in some context. Generally this will be a 'party in role'. This property is not intended to be used to relate a thing to some independent thing which it is managed by, only to something in the role of being that which manages it.
name: The target or range of this property should be read as always being some kind of 'relative thing', that is a thing defined in some context. Generally this will be a 'party in role'. This property is not intended to be used to relate a thing to some independent thing which it is managed by, only to something in the role of being that which manages it.

id: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified to clean up references to external dictionaries that don't meet FIBO policies, eliminate ambiguity where possible, eliminate the superproperties of produces and is produced by, whose semantics are different from their parent properties, and improve ISO 704 compliance of definitions.
name: Relations.rdf version of this ontology was modified to clean up references to external dictionaries that don't meet FIBO policies, eliminate ambiguity where possible, eliminate the superproperties of produces and is produced by, whose semantics are different from their parent properties, and improve ISO 704 compliance of definitions.

name: produces through the application of one or more mathematical or logical steps or rules

id: This property should be read as describing the conferral of some legal power or duty, some commitment or some social construct, and is a property of some social construct such as an agreement or some legal authority.
